snippet: The Chicago Symphony Orchestra, led by Riccardo Muti, resolved a brief strike last week in time to perform Carl Orff’s “Carmina Burana” on Wednesday night at Carnegie Hall’s season-opening concert.
abstract: Anthony Tommasini reviews performance by the Chicago Symphony Orchestra with the Chicago Symphony Chorus and the Chicago Children's Choir at Carnegie Hall.
lead_paragraph: The Chicago Symphony Orchestra, led by Riccardo Muti, resolved a brief strike last week in time to perform Carl Orff’s “Carmina Burana” on Wednesday night at Carnegie Hall’s season-opening concert.

headline.seo: Chicago Symphony Orchestra at Carnegie Hall
headline.main: An Unabashed ‘Carmina,’ From Chicago to Carnegie
headline.print_headline: An Unabashed ‘Carmina,’ From Chicago to Carnegie
